title: La. College grounds Belhaven’s aerial attacks
text:
La. College grounds Belhaven’s aerial attacks LaMar Gafford , lgafford@thetowntalk.com, (318) 487-6352 3:07 p.m. CDT October 11, 2015 Louisiana College has two new versions of its interlocking “LC” logo. (Photo: Courtesy LCWildcats.net) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Facing against legendary coach Hal Mumme and his air raid attack, Louisiana College knew that it needed to ground it somehow. 
The Wildcat defense put together a late three-and-out and scored twice late to defeat Belhaven Saturday, 38-28. 
LC (2-3, 2-1 American Southwest) trailed 28-24 midway through the fourth quarter, but senior quarterback Easton Melancon's 13-yard touchdown pass to Ladarius Gardner gave the team the lead for good, as Aurren Cooksey's 21-yard touchdown made sure it would head home with a two-game winning streak. 
Cooksey, a junior running back, rushed the ball 32 times for 181 yards and helped the Wildcats counter the Blazers' pass-heavy attack. 
His runs set Melancon's passes perfect, as LC jumped out to a 17-0 advantage when junior Cole Crook scored from three yards out with 10:14 remaining in the first half. 
While it was controlled throughout most of the first half, the Belhaven (0-6, 0-2) offense came alive after halftime as freshman quarterback Tristian Hibbler got into a rhythm with his receivers. 
With the Blazer defense forcing Melancon to throw an interception and LC to turn over the ball twice on downs in the span of nine minutes, the Blazers took a four-point lead with 7:29 remaining and looked to ride their wave of momentum to their first win. 
However, Melancon settled in to lead a pair of scoring drives, while a big sack by freshman linebacker Orel Ledet, Jr. helped the Wildcats. 
Melancon completed 20 of his 44 passes for 234 yards, four touchdowns and three interceptions, while Gardner caught four passes for 102 yards. Defensively, the Wildcats recorded five sacks, as sophomore linebacker Ryan DeMattie led the way with eight tackles and a forced fumble. 
Hibbler sparked the Blazers' offense with 308 passing yards and four touchdowns, while sophomore Marquis Hedge ran well for 94 yards and a touchdown. 
LC will host the 10-time defending champion University of Mary Hardin-Baylor next week at Wildcat Field. Kickoff is scheduled for 1 p.m. Read or Share this story: http://www.thetowntalk.com/story/sports/college/lc/2015/10/11/la-college-grounds-belhavens-aerial-attacks/73723684/ TOP VIDEOS
